column1: This triggers the muscle at the lower end of the esophagus (the tube that runs from your mouth to the stomach) to relax.
Symptoms such as nausea, dyspepsia, and heartburn may be relieved by belching.
- Pressure caused by the unconscious swallowing of air - Acid reflux disease (GERD) and heartburn
Call a health care provider if the belching does not go away, or if you also have other symptoms.
